result.execSummary:
The defendant Austin L Krizek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

Serve 30 days in jail, may serve balance on home detention, if eligible according to local jail rules.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Austin L Krizek

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Austin L Krizek in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Austin L Krizek in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:33 am  Court calls the case and states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Attorney Constable states plea agreement.
Attorney Drengler concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: Guilty/No Contest. 

Court questions Defendant.
Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Drengler.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant convicted today.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction be entered.

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Defendant makes statements to the Court.

BY THE COURT:
Court will accept the agreement.
60 days jail.
Pay costs and can use portion of cash bond to do that.
60 days to pay.

Atty Constable makes arguments to the Court re: no objection to huber, but 50% of sentence in custody.
Atty Drengles makes arguments to the Court.

BY THE COURT:
Court orders 30 days in jail before becoming eligible for home detention.
No jail credit.
This sentence will be consecutive to any other sentence.

9:49 am  Case concluded.
and Writ of Habeas Corpus /s/ RJS 05/31/16
records.descr: Petition for writ of habeas corpus

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on June 17, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 27, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Austin L Krizek in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Austin L Krizek in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:04 AM Court calls case.
Atty Constable states appearances.

Matter is set for a pretrial and to quash warrant.

State has no objection to quashing warrant and have the PTC held today.

BY THE COURT:
Court will quash warrant and order that the parties hold the PTC this morning and further proceedings.

Atty Constable addresses the Court, requests bond be reinstated.

BY THE COURT:
Signature bond is to be reinstated.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Ryan Drengler in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:27 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Constable states the appearances.
Atty Constable states that the defendant has once again failed to appear for a PTC.
Atty Drengler makes statements that his client is in jail at this time.
Victim notification had been complied with.
Atty Constable is requesting a Bench warrant with a cash alternative of $500.

BY THE COURT:
Bench warrant with a cash alternative of $100.00
